page.title: 01Countryside east of Bideford
page.content: A rural area producing mainly corn, beef and sheep on family farms with small quantities of potatoes for local sale and other root crops for fattening lambs. The land is often stony, especially on the hill tops, and heavy for working in this undulating country of relatively small fields enclosed by traditional Devon banks topped with trimmed hedges. Some fields are too steep for cultivation being the sides of picturesque little valleys containing small streams. The roads and lanes ae narrow with many bends and gradients whilst the whole area is exposed to prevailing South West wind and rain; so much so that trees grow one sided due to the weather. Little has changed over the years except for the disappearance of many hedge trees due to Dutch Elm disease and for the appearance of
